channel.title: Myhosting VPS problems
channel.description:
Today, my partner and I finally decided it was time to release our project into BETA mode, and to ensure 100% player satisfaction, we decide to purchase a CentOS Virtual Private Server. We were astounded by the performance of the servers, however we are currently having problems with portforwarding. We know for a fact that the server is launching up properly and that is isn't causing the problem with opening the port 43594(as we tested it on another computer and successfully opened the port), so we assume there is a problem with the ports. We currently are waiting for the VPS team to check into the issue, which they said they have already opened port 43594 to accept connections. They are still currently investigating the issue.
Has anyone ever used Myhosting before with hosting RSPS? If so, are they good, or should I go ahead and take advantage of the 30-day money back guarantee?

item.title: Myhosting VPS problems
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I honestly can’t believe the length your support team went to help this guy lol. I think I’ll buy from this company in the future lol

Read full topic

item.title: Myhosting VPS problems
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“chrisa, post:2, topic:452629”]There should be no port restriction within our CentOS VPS as long as you setup the port forwarding properly. Have you checked with our VPS team for assistance? You can email them at virtual-server@myhosting.com. Be sure to include your Account information when contacting them.

Chris A.
Product Manager
http://myhosting.com[/quote]

I respect the amount of patience you have, I would have told him to fuck off and learn the basics of a Linux VPS on google first.

Read full topic

um, did your hosting company seriously come here… i’d feel so embarrassed, haha!

item.title: Myhosting VPS problems
item.dc:creator: @chrisa chrisa
item.description:
@chrisa wrote:

There should be no port restriction within our CentOS VPS as long as you setup the port forwarding properly. Have you checked with our VPS team for assistance? You can email them at virtual-server@myhosting.com. Be sure to include your Account information when contacting them.

Chris A.
Product Manager

myhosting.com

myhosting.com - VPS, Domain Hosting and Hosted Exchange

Affordable VPS, domain hosting and website services for businesses of all sizes.

Read full topic

item.title: Myhosting VPS problems
item.dc:creator: @Krim Krim
item.description:
@Krim wrote:

Today, my partner and I finally decided it was time to release our project into BETA mode, and to ensure 100% player satisfaction, we decide to purchase a CentOS Virtual Private Server. We were astounded by the performance of the servers, however we are currently having problems with portforwarding. We know for a fact that the server is launching up properly and that is isn’t causing the problem with opening the port 43594(as we tested it on another computer and successfully opened the port), so we assume there is a problem with the ports. We currently are waiting for the VPS team to check into the issue, which they said they have already opened port 43594 to accept connections. They are still currently investigating the issue.

Has anyone ever used Myhosting before with hosting RSPS? If so, are they good, or should I go ahead and take advantage of the 30-day money back guarantee?
